title: My Fashion Editor Friend Swears By J.Crew Swimsuits—and They're Massively on Sale Right Now
text: If there’s one thing I can rely on my fashion editor friends for, it’s an unfiltered, honest opinion before I make a purchase—the kind of intel that lets you know what’s actually worth it. And when it comes to swimwear (one of the things I’m pickiest about), Who What Wear’s Senior Fashion Editor Eliza Huber swears by J.Crew.“I own two J.Crew bikinis—one underwire style and one triangle, and I have been extremely impressed with both,” Huber told me. “I probably own 30–40 swimsuits, some costing up to $400, and honestly, I only wear about five of them—two being those bikinis from J.Crew.”Her favorite? “I especially love the ’90s No-Tie Bottoms. They’re a little high-cut, but not dramatically so. I’d honestly buy them in every available color—and might, now that they’re on sale.”All of the brand’s swimwear is literally up to 50% off right now with the code SHOPSALE (through April 28), so if you’re thinking about upgrading your swimsuits, now’s the perfect time. I just bought one too. j.crew '90s No-Tie String Bikini Bottom The ’90s No-Tie String Bikini Bottom—Eliza’s favorite. j.crew Perfect String Bikini Top Don’t forget the matching top. j.crew Claudia Scrunchie One-Piece This seersucker one-piece reminds me of Hunga G. j.crew Heritage Triangle Bikini Top You can never go wrong with a classic black bikini… j.crew Heritage Hipster String Bikini Bottom …with a string-tie bottom. j.crew Sleek Ruched One-Shoulder One-Piece Swimsuit I love this baby blue color. jcrew Classic Full-Coverage Bikini Bottom j.crew Claudia Bikini Top in Classic Sculpt Also love this elevated color… j.crew Hallie Bikini Bottom in Classic Sculpt …with a high-rise bottom. j.crew Claudia Bikini Top in Classic Sculpt j.crew Boy Short Bikini Bottom in Classic Sculpt I’ve been into swim shorts this year. j.crew 1993 Underwire Bikini Top This underwire bikini top is one of J.Crew’s most iconic styles… j.crew Heritage 1989 High-Leg Bikini Bottom …just pair it with high-cut bottoms. j.crew Contrast Straight-Neck Bikini Top j.crew Contrast-Trim String Bikini Bottom
html:
If there’s one thing I can rely on my fashion editor friends for, it’s an unfiltered, honest opinion before I make a purchase—the kind of intel that lets you know what’s actually worth it. And when it comes to swimwear (one of the things I’m pickiest about), Who What Wear’s Senior Fashion Editor Eliza Huber swears by J.Crew.

“I own two J.Crew bikinis—one underwire style and one triangle, and I have been extremely impressed with both,” Huber told me. “I probably own 30–40 swimsuits, some costing up to $400, and honestly, I only wear about five of them—two being those bikinis from J.Crew.”

Her favorite? “I especially love the ’90s No-Tie Bottoms. They’re a little high-cut, but not dramatically so. I’d honestly buy them in every available color—and might, now that they’re on sale.”

All of the brand’s swimwear is literally up to 50% off right now with the code SHOPSALE (through April 28), so if you’re thinking about upgrading your swimsuits, now’s the perfect time. I just bought one too.
